Retrieve owners

get_owners.Rd

Retrieve owners from the owners API endpoint.

get_owners(
  token_path = hubspot_token_get(),
  apikey = hubspot_key_get(),
  include_inactive = TRUE,
  email = NULL
)

Arguments

token_path

Path to OAuth 2.0 token. See hubspot_token_create().
apikey

API key to work with Hubspot (only used if token_path is NULL). See hubspot_key_set().
include_inactive

Boolean indicating whether to include inactive owners (defined as owners without any active remotes.)
email

Search for owners matching the specified email address (exact match).

Value

List of owners

See also

Other getters: get_companies(), get_company_properties(), get_contact_properties(), get_contacts(), get_deal_pipelines(), get_deal_properties(), get_deals()

Examples

# \dontrun{
owners <- get_owners()
#> Warning: Selecting ‘env’ backend. Secrets are stored in environment variables
#> Could not find Hubspot API key, will use the 'demo' key.
#> Please run hubspot_key_set() to set your API key.
active_owners <- get_owners(include_inactive = FALSE)
#> Warning: Selecting ‘env’ backend. Secrets are stored in environment variables
#> Could not find Hubspot API key, will use the 'demo' key.
#> Please run hubspot_key_set() to set your API key.
get_owners(email = "demo@hubspot.com")
#> Warning: Selecting ‘env’ backend. Secrets are stored in environment variables
#> Could not find Hubspot API key, will use the 'demo' key.
#> Please run hubspot_key_set() to set your API key.
